intro: Graphardisia vigoi, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Graphardisia vigoi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories.
